publicationStmt.p: This is an XML-TEI markup of the original publications by SIL Mexico for the purposes of: archival and for the creation of a body of Mixtepec-Mixtec language resources (LR) (ISO: mix). Encoded documents used with the permission of original authors.

sourceDesc.bibl: Ntintsitsa ntivixi Gómez Hernández, María; Beckmann, Gisela; Nieves, María M.. 2008. (2nd ed.).Instituto Lingüístico de Verano, A.C. Tlalpan, D.F., México Obtained from:

abstract.p: Una tortuga quería ir a pasear, pero era muy lenta. Cuando por fin le dieron un aventón, abrió su boca en un mal momento y sufrió un accidente.

textDesc.channel: @mode:'w' means that the primary means of utilising this document is by reading it's written form;

normalization.ab: 2018-03-27Spelling of lexical items which in the old orthography were homographs and which have been changed according to updated orthographic principles as per ../Mille/GUIA_ORTOGRAFICA_PRELIMINAR_Short_version.xml. Instances of "ña" still remain to be changed pending consultation with Mille (or other person working on orthography).

list.item: Mixtec content found at following locations: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg/w

English translations are defined in relation to their Mixtec equivalents in the following location: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/spanGrp[@type='translation']/span[@xml:lang='en'] the value of //span[@target] is the pointer to the Mixtec translation equivalentwhere a preceding sibling is: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg

Spanish translations are defined in relation to their Mixtec equivalents in the following location: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/spanGrp[@type='translation']/span[@xml:lang='es'] the value of //span[@target] is the pointer to the Mixtec translation equivalent where a preceding sibling is: //text[@xml:lang='mix']/body/div/p/seg

spanGrp.span: One day there was a turtle that was walking around all over a lagoon.
Everyday he walked because he wanted to go for a walk but he could not walk fast.
Cada día caminaba porque quiería salir a caminar pero no podía caminar rápido.
why is this before the verb "kuaka"? is "yee kuaka" a phrase? (syn ofjust "kuaka"?)
One day it came out from the lagoon and sat down and waited for the crow to pass by so he can do him a favor and carry it, then he walked toward it.
Un día salió de la laguna y se sentó y esperó....un cuervo...
'ask'? is "ya'a" part of the expression? "nchatu ya'a"?
get parsing of all parts! ask a favor "kaki ñamani ña"?
And when it saw a crow it was very happy and then said the following:
Y cuando vió un cuervo estaba muy feliz y dijó el siguente:
Then it heard a crow who then said to it:
Y oyó un cuervo que le dijó:
And then the turtle was very happy and then said the following:
Y la tortuga estaba muy feliz y dijó el siguente:
Do me a favor, carry me and let's go for a stroll because I really want to go but I can't walk fast enough.
Hágame un favor, cargame y vamos ir a passear porque quiero realmente pero no puedo caminar bastante rápido.
double check 1sg for this verb (google sheet?)
I will not help carry you because you are too heavy.
No voy ayudar cargarte porqué eres demasiado pessado.
I will not go with you.
It said and then flew away.
Then the turtle's feeling were hurt and it began to cry sitting on the bank of the lagoon.
Y los sentimientos de la tortuga estaban heridos y empezó a llorar sentado a la orilla de la laguna.
Then two buzzards arrived on the path and they saw that the turtle was crying, then they approached and asked:
Y dos zopilotes llegaron en el camino y vieron que la tortuga estaba llorando y se acercaron y preguntaron:
I'm crying because the crow didn't want to carry me and I really want to go for a stroll with him.
Estoy llorando porque el cuervo no quería cargarme y quiero realmente ir a pasear con él.
is this uniflected? How is "kaka" inflected for 1sg?
If you want to go, let's go, and don't cry because your feelings were hurt.
Se quieres a ir, vamos, y no llores porque tus sentimientos estaban heridos.
Then the turtle was very happy and said:
Y la tortuga estaba muy feliz y dijó:
Now I will know how this town is and how it is behind the mountains
is this not 'with' or a child pronoun?
is this "xoo ka(a)"? and should there be another "a" in "ka"?
Then the buzzards looked for a branch and said to the turtle:
Y los zopilotes buscaron un palo y dijeron a la tortuga:
is "branch" or "stick" a better translation? Is "numa" a synonym of "nta'a yutú"?
In the spanish tranlation: should there also be a "le"? 'le dijó a la tortuga'?
Grab on to this with your mouth and don't talk because you will fall.
(Muerde/aguanta) esto con la boca y no hables porque cayerás.
is this a phrase "tiun tuun"? 'to bite'; (get other forms!) get components of this phrase
why is this not inflected in future?
Y pues los buitres despegaron volando.
And they went up the path and then they ran into the crow, and the crow said to the buzzards:
Y iban por el camino y encontraron el cuervo, y el cuervo dijó a los zopilotes:
Why are you carying that guy, he's so heavy?
¿Por qué estas cargando eso, es tan pessado?
And the turtle heard and said:
Y oyó la tortuga y dijó:
Because they are not like youuuuuuu.
It spoke and then it fell all the way down to the ground.
Habló y pues se cayó todo el camino hacia la tierra.
